website_summaries.verdict: This functional dog bed is excellent for those looking to keep their dog warm in chilly weather.
pros: If plugged in, the bed stays warm even when not in use
When the dog climbs onto the mat, the bed can rise up to 102 degrees
Many heating options for your animal
Includes a fleece cover to make the product softer
cons: Not as soft as other models
Need to unplug the product to keep it from using electricity

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Outdoor Cat Shelter
customer_reviews.text: I used the small K&H Manufacturing Lectro-Soft Outdoor Heated Bed in a home-made outdoor cat shelter all of last winter. I've left it outside in the shelter for a year now and it is still working perfectly. I removed the cover and instead covered the bed and bottom of the shelter with straw. This year I've replaced the straw with 100% polyester fleece blankets cut into strips. The fleece retains its warmth even when wet and is not dusty like the straw. This is a well-made product. The neighborhood stray cats certainly seem to love it during the cold winter.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: We have a feral cat that has adopted us and although we can now pet (sometimes) he won't come into the house. I worry about it being too cold outside for him so I purchased this to put in a small pet house we purchased last year for him. He was on it in less than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: StitchinGal

customer_reviews.title: Barely warm
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this heating pad to work for my 2 cats that will need to stay outdoors in a little waterproof cat house. But after following all the instructions, it barely got warm. I tried putting in in the kitties' bed, and they weren't interested in it. I tried setting them on it and petting them for several minutes until they relaxed so the pad would heat up to their body temperature, but as soon as I left, they got up and went elsewhere. I left it there for a few more days hoping they would try it on their own, but they refused. It is just not any warmer than a regular blanket. Very disappointed. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Moore

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the negative reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my Doberman can have a warm place to lay. It never gets warm. I waited for over 30 minutes and it barley gets warm at all. I thought I was getting better quality because this is more expensive and they had good reviews, however, this is not what I wanted at all. In addition, the soft cover is not held into place at all by anything and easily comes off when you try to move it or if it is stepped on. Poor lazy design. The could have something to secure it onto the plastic part. That’s super annoying as you constantly have to affix the soft cover onto the plastic part repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Dalya84

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I bought this for my German Shepherd and her puppies. I have a pool in a insulated garage and I wanted to keep the pups warm because it’s winter here. This worked for about an hour then quit working without me knowing it. I lost one of my pups and I believe it’s because this quit working. I ended up bringing them in the house. BUYER BEWARE. I BREED GERMAN SHEPHERDS AND because I depended on this mat I lost a pup.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: These heated pads work flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th one we’ve bought, plus we bought one of the larger size. All of them have worked flawlessly. This is the second season on three of them. We are using them in outdoor cat shelters. The cats have no hesitation in getting in the shelters, and they all hunker down on these heated pads in wet or cold weather. Last winter, four orphan kittens survived through the coldest days by snuggling together in a shelter with one of these pads. The cats are mostly house pets that have been abandoned by their owners, or strayed. We provide shelters, food, and water, and when we can catch them, spaying and neutering and shots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cat it was purchased for loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the feral that adopted us. While we had provided a shelter for the cat, she has spent many cold nights on our porch, under the porchlight, on her warm mat. In fact, she fusses at us if she has to get off the mat! I don't think she has ever had anything soft to lay on before. The cover has plastic feeling pieces on the underside so the bottom doesn't soak up moisture. The fleece top is nice and soft. I did not find instructions on how to wash the cover but I will hand wash it in the bathtub in the spring, and let it air dry. She loves it, which is what matters.
customer_reviews.author: WSPE539

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic job when it is working
customer_reviews.text: I keep a spare one of these on hand knowing it will stop functioning unexpectedly. Been using this product for about 6 years. The life span seems to be one winter. We did have one that lasted 2 years. What are you going to do, though. Our dog loves being outside so we keep this in her outdoor dog house in case she gets cold. We have a fenced back yard and she enjoys running the fence with the neighbors dogs and chasing squirrels etc. We keep it plugged in 24/7 from about October to March, so that may contribute to the life span. It is safe and provides a low steady heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: My doggy would rather not
customer_reviews.text: I thought this heating pad was terrific. It heats nicely, has an adjustable mushiness and has a washable fleece-like cover. However, my little gal (doggy) - not so much. I'm not sure why (maybe the plastic noise/feel??) ... I've tried multiple air adjustments, etc., but even after many months she much prefers and gravitates to a regular heating pad. This is an apples to apples comparison/choice as the differing pads have been presented using approximately the same amount of heat, same bed, bedding, etc. Satisfied mum, but fussy pup? If only she could better articulate her dissatisfaction, I could give a more positive review.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Defective AND not as described
customer_reviews.text: Whomever wrote the item description took a very creative review. First and foremost, mine doesn't heat. This is fine because the fact that it's hideous looking made me want to return it anyway. You either have to keep it plugged in or unplugged. There's no on/off button. The "heating" mat is substantial. If it worked, my Labrador would love it and not destroy it. I would've replaced the cheap cover with something more plush, as he'd certainly rip it simply by getting up and down a few times.
customer_reviews.author: We Love Pat Altschul

customer_reviews.title: We inherited my dad's cat and we wanted to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: We inherited my dad's cat and we wanted to keep him, but will not have a cat in the house. We live in the north east, so I built him his own house and purchased the heated bed to keep him warm. It took a little time and a few treats before he would go inside, but now he loves it and stays inside all the time. So far this heated cat bed is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Great, warm, comfy, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I put these everywhere for my dogs. In their crates, on the couch, they love them. They have so much warmth despite what you feel with your hand. They're glued to these all day when it's cold. Easy to clean. Doesn't matter that they aren't puffy and soft. I put them on top of a pile of blankets or their bed and it's soft enough for them. Are people who complain about these not being soft trying to put these on wood floors? I wonder because dogs tend to lay on hard surfaces voluntarily, and mine love these pads. Maybe cats are different and pickier.
customer_reviews.author: E.E.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my outdoor kitty cozy and happy duringr the cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This item was great for my outdoors kitty. He wouldn't lay directly on top of it but he liked lying up against it. He used it all winter and slept toasty and comfortable! Cost a little more than I wanted to spend but it's been worth it to see him sleeping comfy during the cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome For Doghouses and Feral Cat Shelters
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of these pads outside for our small dog and also neighborhood feral cats that live locally and visit in cold months. We use the pads inside igloos and regular doghouses and then cover with an inexpensive fleece cover or throw from a local store. So far (fingers crossed) the pads have all held up from October to May for about 5 years. I can't attest to how these work for large dogs but I highly recommend for any small to medium pet that needs safe warming outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: ABCMVC5

customer_reviews.title: Defective or is this the way it's supposed to work?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a small size bed for our terrier puppy to be used indoors near the kitchen. Only a small 6 inch circle in the center of the bed showed any warming at all, and was barely noticeable. The rest of the bed had no warming at all. No way would could this be used outdoors in winter and expect your pet to survive. The fleece cover was very nice, but if it doesn't warm, why buy it? Also, it was $31.65 when I ordered 3 weeks ago, now its $43.61, a 38% price increase in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: ATLnGA

customer_reviews.title: Poor results
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions and product failed to produce the benefits promoted. All it is a poorly designed small inflatable bladder with a cheaply made slip-over cover with an awkwardly attached power cord. A weak product by every standard. Save your cash and invite your pet inside or better yet into the bed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this product! She prefers being outside, so I got this for my own piece of mind being winter is coming. I have felt it once when she got up & it was nice & warm. I've only had it for a few weeks, so we'll see when the temps get even colder. Also, some complain that it's flat.....my dog doesn't seem to care at all ;) I think this is a great product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Larson

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have two big livestock guardian dogs that have just been transplanted from coastal California to the Rocky Mountains. I bought the first one to see how it would do outside on the porch. Not only did it perform well, the dogs fought over who would lay on it. I bought another and brought peace to the front porch. We have since moved them to the barn where the dogs stay. They are content. There is no better testimony than that of the two who use these mats.
customer_reviews.author: Sue in soCal

customer_reviews.title: These are so great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a beautiful maine coon cat show up at my house in the country but I already have 3 cats so I just couldn't possibly let it in. I bought this for the porch and it comforts me to see the cat on it. She liked it so much I got one for her for the front port and the back porch. These are great!
customer_reviews.author: a frequent visitor

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Is FINALLY Using It!
customer_reviews.text: When I first put it in his outdoor cat house, he flat refused to go back inside and even spent a couple of nasty storms huddled up under my porch. This is a half-feral cat. I'm thinking the cover of this pad scared him into thinking there was some kind of animal in his house! Yesterday, I saw him through the clear flap, once again inside, and grooming himself! Today I watched him casually come out of that nest stretching and yawning. One less cat I have to worry about! He loves it! Took him six weeks but - He is finally enjoying it! And I LOVE how economical it is to run!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME for the ferel cats who use our covered patio in the winter! I purchased two, put a hallway rug runner on the bar, placed these warming pads on top of the runner, and then placed a comforter on top that I also purchased from Amazon. The sweet kitties love it and I have the peace of mind knowing that they are warm and comfortable. We also closed the patio curtains to block the wind. With this setup and the food we have been feeding them, I have a feeling that we are now the guardians of six cats. That's okay though -- we love animals.
customer_reviews.author: R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 years.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2009. Stopped working last night. It has always been exposed outdoors on a concrete pad. No special care other than taking it inside during a heavy rain fall. I have also hand washed and soaked it multiple times over with out any problems. Far exceeded the 2 year warranty. I will be purchasing another after investigating the fault. I suspect the whole heating element has surpassed it's life span. Surprised to see all the negative reviews. Hopefully the manufacturer has not started to cut production cost's. Purchased on Amazon December, 8th 2009 - $69.38
customer_reviews.author: J. Kristyniak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our TNR cat that sleeps on our porch in an insulated cat carrier. It fits it perfectly. Our feral is an elderly cat we were never able to bring indoors. The newer models, like the one we just purchased, are much more padded. This makes it more comfortable for his old bones. He sleeps close to 20 hours a day now. He only leaves to move a bit and go to the bathroom. I can tell he likes this one more than the one we had for over 8 years. It was a very good price and has been worth every penny for his comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Janet G.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this last winter for our elderly, outdoor dog. She seems to enjoy lying on it in cooler weather and I feel better knowing it's there for her if she needs it. We do keep her inside when the temps are 32 or below since that's what the vet suggested - and I'm not confident the pad provides enough warmth when it's below freezing. We unplugged it for the summer but left it in her kennel and it looks the same (albeit a little dirtier) as when we put it in there. I bought one for my sister who has several cats and she said the cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Melia Leanne

customer_reviews.title: ... his own who started coming around when he was pretty young. (We have eight indoor cats and know ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a feral cat that has claimed our front porch as his own who started coming around when he was pretty young. (We have eight indoor cats and know the difference between a stray and a feral. He is 100% feral. I have never been closer to him that three or four feet. If bringing Linden inside was an option, he would be inside.) We bought him a little house; however, since we have some pretty nasty winters, I wanted to give him something warmer. This worked perfectly! He seemed very cozy this past winter in his little house. It is easy to clean, which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: A Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Still Going, but not sure if it's still a great value
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I was lucky to find this about a year ago before the price almost quadrupled to ~$42, but I can say that it's still functioning after a season of use. Not the warmest thing in the world (really an adjunct to a decent shelter that protects from exposure/cold winds), but what can one expect at 20 Watts? Even at virtually 100% electrical conversion efficiency (like all resistance-type heaters), it's still 20W. But it was a good addition for my smallish, lightly insulated (with bubble wrap pipe insulation and a fleece) kitty house on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: KatKit103

customer_reviews.title: My little dog loves the warming pad
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I had put out the warming pad into my dog's bed, he (a rescue dog from ever-warm Los Angeles) took to it. It does not seem too warm up very much but I prefer this 'average doggie-body temperature' to a hot heating pad. It is just right for him in order not to shiver, having been used to the sunny weather of L.A. , and when he is happy, I am happy. Having read some of the reviews, I will update my own review at winter time when he might not even need the pad since the entire house will be heated.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Gabriele

customer_reviews.title: A good design with a poor quality cover
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of keeping our medium sized dog comfortable in sub-freezing temperatures. The thermostat seems to work well. However, the cover is flimsy and as worn out already after only a few weeks. Our dog weighs about 35 pounds, and doesn't scratch or dig, but there's a large hole in the middle of the cover already. Clumps of cover material are scattered around his kennel. We are currently seeking alternative covers as I won't spend any more money buying the same cover again.
customer_reviews.author: Isherwood

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get warm enough to make a difference. My dog didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn’t use it. She likes heating pads but wanted nothing to do with this product. It really didn’t get warm at all and the cover is very poor quality. The warmest it got was warm enough to take the chill off of the plastic I’m not sure if what I received was defective but I’m giving this to my sister to see if her cats like it
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Defective upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt stay inflated. bought 1 from other online retailer and its been perfect. should have bought second one from them instead. nothing but problems with amazon lately.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Paired with the K&H Original Cot, and the canopy... my dogs love it.  Even the cat.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought our second one because in our multiple-pet home this is always in high-demand. Our spoiled pups have this heat mat atop their K&H Original Cot. The large pad works great on the 25x32 cot. We have small dogs that share the pads, the cat often joins them. I love that it is easy to wash the cover... it is just attached by the corners but secured with the electric cord threading thru a hole. And it isn't wasteful on energy... you can barely feel the heat with your hand... it heats up to a comfortable level when your pet lays on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Good product does what it claims!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver. I have three big dogs, and I can’t always let them in the house. Sometimes they get muddy, too dirty to come in, or leave even been swimming on days when it’s almost 32°F! Rather than let them come and less of the house, they go on the back porch and they warm up on these wonderful pads, where they sleep all night in complete comfort. I have no guilt in keeping the dogs out because they have a wonderful way to stay warm now.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Perkins

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a stay cat that is no longer stay but wants to live outside. Placed it in a cat cabana and he loves it. First time in he wasn’t sure then we put his food dish closer so he lays on it to eat and is now a happy cat. It seems to heat only with pressure that is good and it doesn’t get to hot just right.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: What?! You can't use it with an extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: You can't use it with an extension cord! That's crazy and makes an otherwise good product worthless. Unless your kennel has a plug in it, forget it. They have a big warning in the package warning you to not use it with an extension cord for safety. I don't want to burn down my kennel and dog, or burn down the garage.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Does not get advertised temperature!
customer_reviews.text: Did not get anywhere near advertised temperature. Total waste of money. Go to Petco. They carry better ones. The last one I bought there lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elderly Dog Joints
customer_reviews.text: Don't be like me. Read the instructions first. I opened it, put the lamby wool on and plugged it in. Hard as a rock, barelywarm after 5 mins. My 21 yr old son read the instructions. Unplug the air valve on the back and wait 20 mins. Now the elderly dog we bought it for has to fight the cats off of it. Works great. We have hardwood floors and she struggles to stand after lying on her dog bed. Now, this seems to help her to not be as stiff.
customer_reviews.author: KatieDidnt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly german shephard and he used for a long time. It kept him warm outside and inside. But my other dog would try and move him off it so she could use it. Now he's gone and she has it all to herself. Its a must if your dogs spend time outdoors in the cold weather. The cat even uses it. So glad I bought this. And after over a year, its holding up well. I'm surprised as it gets abused, rain, dog nails, and its holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stevens

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves this bed
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My Jack Russell terrier puppy loves it and couldn’t mess up with it:) She was able to destroy the previous one. She stays outside and sleep in her house, so this bed helped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Yozki

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works like advertised! My aging pup loves it; he even uses it in the heat of summer! Not a complaint (you get what you pay for), but at its current price, I can only afford one for now, otherwise I'd have one in every room. One suggestion I have for the manufacture is make a model with a timer. I bought a high-amp programmable timer so that it comes on and is ready for him in the kitchen by the time we get up and I'm preparing his breakfast, and switches off in the late evening when we go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for outside kitties in the winter, but while testing it out, our cat climbed on and claimed it. So now it sits on her window ledge, I plug it in every morning and she snoozes on the warm pad literally all day. This pillow is great - it’s not overly warm, but it reacts with the cats heat and makes them super warm, if that makes sense. The sherpa cover is very soft too. I’m going to have to order another for the outside kitties now!
customer_reviews.author: Pineapples

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one of my strays. Has been a big hit & I plan to buy 4 more. I have purchased the hard ones in the past but the cats didn't like them because they had to lay on them for awhile in order for the heat to activate. This pad is soft & really warm. My grandma cat has not moved off of it, I put it in a covered box after this picture & she stayed on it even while I moved it over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, solid product works with 2014 Tacoma bed outlet
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying the heating function for animals in the Tacoma truck bed using the bed outlet. Fills with air for fullness, but gets a bit shifty if you add too much air and the internal coils can be felt. So comfort is maybe lacking, as the animals shift positions more than usual. Cord is sturdy. Free cover is kind of cheap. Overall, pretty good animal bed. They do seem to really like the heating function.
customer_reviews.author: Recon

customer_reviews.title: Our outdoor cat hasn't left this mat since he discovered it
customer_reviews.text: I wish we'd found this years ago for our outdoor kitty. He had disappeared for a few days when freezing temperatures hit, and the brand new bed went unused for a few days. But he came home yesterday to eat and he hasn't left his heated mat in his outdoor kitty condo since. Only suggestion would be for the instructions for the testing to give an idea of how much the bed may inflate. We followed the setup instructions, but the bed didn't inflate all that much, and we were unsure if we did it right. A photo in the instructions of what it was supposed to appear like would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: kendrakw

customer_reviews.title: Nancy Approved
customer_reviews.text: I looked through a ton of different heated cat beds before settling on this one for its price, functionality, and good reviews, and I'm very happy with my choice. We placed it on a table by a window, and my cat loves it. It's not very big and I guess I'd rather it bigger, but it works well for one cat at a time, though Nancy (pictured) is on the small side. Our other larger cat doesn't use it much. I love that I don't have to worry about it overheating, and it does a great job responding to weight and heating quickly. A wonderful thing to have if your pets are home alone often during the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an orphaned kitten to have a very warm cubby to sleep in. I chose this heating pad over others because I thought it would be more water resistant in case he didn’t always make it to his litter box. It has worked perfectly and I am very happy with it. I like how it only really gets toasty warm when a cat is sitting on it. The rest of the time it conserves energy by only being slightly warm when no one is resting on it. I also like how the cord is protected with the metal spiral from the kitten trying to chew on it
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua loves this bed and sleeps on it during the day. He frequently paws at the cover to fluff it up like he does his other regular blankets, but he still loves it. I love it because it does not heat up the room like his winter heater did. I like the fact it does not stay hot all day if he is not on the bed. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: oldequilter

customer_reviews.title: Cats are content.  I'm not worrying anymore for their comfort.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this pad. I have a wooden cat shelter for my semi-feral cats. Some times they like to come in and visit. Some times they like it outside. Well, now my outside cat-shelter has this on the floor with a thin furry blanket on top of it. It's getting down into the 30's now and my cats are hanging out in their cat-shelter on our back porch. I've put my hand in the shelter and have felt a comfortable warmth that is always maintained. They've got someplace to hang out now to recharge their body temperature. Great pad.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Princess loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older 17 year old cat who has gradually lost weight over the years and is pretty much skin and bones. She's constantly on the heat vents even though we keep the house warm. I decided to get this bed for her so she could be comfortable and warm. Wow she doesn't leave it unless she has to eat/drink/potty. Definitely a good buy. I recommend to anyone with an aging pet. I want her to be comfortable in her twilight years and this bed has really helped me do that. I'll probably purchase other k & h products after seeing how great this one is.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Dog destroyed it instantly
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept. The price is great. I put the heating pad underneath another pad to hide it from my Great Dane. When I came back FIVE minutes later it was shredded finer than mozzarella cheese for a dinner at Olive Garden. For the two minutes I felt it - it felt soft. I'm sure it would have been easy to clean. BUT - take my review with a grain of salt. If you have a "super chewer" scroll on by this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Earl

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used it for one season in our feral cat’s house. He slept on it every night for 4 months. It was always warm, not too hot, to the touch. Didn’t raise our electricity bill at all. We did need to buy an outdoor extension cord and cord cover that goes over where the cords come together to keep it dry. Highly recommended for outdoor or indoor animals.
customer_reviews.author: june

customer_reviews.title: My  outdoor  feral  cats  like  it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several years back to keep my kitty (outside feral cat) warm in the cold winter. Couldn't find this again until this year and what I like it the outer cover is soft (you can inflate it with air) which is much softer on the cat and on a cold night or day they go to their outside house that has this heating pad in it .
customer_reviews.author: nurse lady

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have this pet bed in a house I set up for a fixed young cat that was sitting on my doorstep very hungry..I started feeding the cat cause it’s ear was clipped so I knew it was fixed.. so I set up a house with this heated bed in it, and it works great and kitty is always in there when it’s cold. Had it a year so far. It saved his life I’m sure. I even bought a second one just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisoola

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our outdoor cat absolutely loves the heating pad. Especially since the last couple of weeks we've been as low as minus7 up to a sweltering ten or eleven above zero. We bought an igloo and then the heating pad. He loves both. He's been on his own for at least 3 years. We've been feeding and taking care of him outside for a year now. We tried to catch "Oscar" and take him to a vet but he'll have none of it. We personally feel the K&H pet products are absolutely the best. Heart, soul and quality are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably warm
customer_reviews.text: This was suppose to go outside for the rabbit but it has not made it to his cage yet as we plugged it in to test it for the day and the cats wont leave the mat now. So looks like we will need to purchase an additional mat so the cats can be happy also.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Two Paws Up
customer_reviews.text: My outdoor cat, who comes and goes from my back deck, loves this heated bed. When night-time temperatures fall below 50 degrees Farenheit, she'll spend the full night on the bed, instead of sleeping elsewhere or roaming. When it rains, since my back deck isn't covered, I place the top of a round dome Booda litter box on top of the bed to block the rain. The bed (12" x 18" for the small version) sticks out the back of the Booda dome by a few inches, but I cover the entire Booda dome with plastic wrap/sheeting, to make sure no rain penetrates. She also shows her contentment verbally, and by "making muffins" on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: OnTheEdge

customer_reviews.title: Barn cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased for my older barn cats. I have used the first one for 2 winters in an outdoor cat house (small doghouse built by my husband). It sits next to the garage and we run an outdoor rated extension cord from the garage to it. The cats love it and it doesn't appear to use much electricity. The cover can be removed and washed. The heating pad itself is vinyl covered so it can be wiped clean if needed. This size pretty much fits one cat but I have had 2 curl up together on it. I had to purchase this second one because another cat discovered it and claimed it for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Retiredgma

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have a socialized feral cat outside I've been taking care of for 7 years (wish so much I could bring her in but there are jealousy issues with my indoor cats), and this bed is an absolute blessing for winter! I made a little house on my front porch out of a tote, put this inside, and it took her all of 10 minutes to fall in love with it. So thankful to have found this, as the cat house I have outback with its blankets and pillows just wasn't retaining enough warmth for the cold Jersey winters. I would absolutely recommend this for anyone who takes care of strays or ferals.
customer_reviews.author: Nickie

customer_reviews.title: My two cats just didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I think this does what it is supposed to do, but my outdoor cat just won't go in the doghouse when it is in there, so it's currently inside. I also tried to put it by a radiator for my senior cat and he also wasn't enthused about it (I got the impression he sat on it as it was in front of the radiator, but he would have preferred the floor). I wish the cats would have used it -- I'd feel less guilty about the outdoor feral cat if he at least had warm bedding. I'll hang on to it in the hopes another feral cat will like it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: when I plugged the heater in after following the instructions, I put a small flannel blanket over top of it. I purchased an outdoor cat house for my stray. When I checked it later, my cat was sprawled out, on his back, paws hanging out! I think he just might love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it
customer_reviews.text: I cut the corners of their bed and slipped the heating pad into it. I find them both in the bed, 15 min after turning it on. They love it. They will come jump into my lap after lying in the bed, and their fur will have this soothing warm feeling. It feels like putting a recently dried sock on during a cold day. The pad only gets warm, not hot, so there is nothing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: TheDrakeEquator

customer_reviews.title: yes buy this
customer_reviews.text: cover is only okay. seems like it was nicer on the last one i bought, but now they sell nice covers. ugh. that said, the brand is reliable which is important. the mat itself works through super cold weather so i would buy it again. the price is high. i'd wait for a sale-esp since you may need to buy a cover too. (cover is thin and only wraps around to cover the front of the mat)
customer_reviews.author: mrsMe

customer_reviews.title: Great heating Pad
customer_reviews.text: I picked one of these up to replace the older, smaller one we had in our dogs house. We have an igloo style doghouse that sits on the covered back porch. We live in NC so it does not stay cold most of the year but he does like to lay in it during the few cold months we get. I am happy with this since he does not seem to be effected by the winter we have here.
customer_reviews.author: NCGaston

customer_reviews.title: stays warm
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a year and it's still going strong. Very durable and the cover slips on & off easily for washing. It's my cat's favorite place to be & works well inside or out. I also like that it always feels a little warm to the touch, rather than other similar products that only feel warm when there is direct pressure on them. If using it outside, you still need a place to plug it in and shelter it from rain, but it's perfect for a reliable heat source inside an outdoor shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Bonnie loves her new K&H Pet Products Lectro-Soft Heated Outdoor Pet Bed
customer_reviews.text: Bonnie was a barn cat in IL that moved with us to SA, TX. She lives on our screened in patio and loves her pet bed for the cold 30 degree night temperatures. The pad is small as Bonnie is a large (not over weight) American shorthair so when she is curled up she JUST fits on the bed. I rated "easy to clean" as a 3 as she has only had the pet bed for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Catnip

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfy but serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: It took while for him to give it a try, but now on the coldest days of winter, I wake up to see him using the pad in the mornings (before I turn on the heater). I feel he tolerates it more than like it, actually. The material is too rigid to be comfortable (he likes some snuggle feeling) and feels bulky even after doing the best to remove the air from inside. It would be better if it was also made in a round shape (it would fit many cat beds in the market) and had a softer blanket cover to make up for the material (wich I guess cannot be made softer).
customer_reviews.author: Mônica Klein

customer_reviews.title: They love it and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love it and the porch cats love it. I only bought one, for the old crabby black cat. I'd been worried about the younger white cat and debated on buying another one. After about a month, she figured out why that other cat spent so much time in the new box that I put on the porch. It gets down to the mid 30's here at night and they both love it. It's got a removable cover and the cord has a metal spring on it to prevent anyone from taking a chew on it. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: SurrealChereal

customer_reviews.title: Good for pets with arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old cat had arthritis and we were using a heating pad, but this is thicker, softer and turns off by itself when she’s not on it. 4 stars are because it’s not as soft as I thought, but she loves it. My friend has had one for a year and recommended it and it’s been great. I normally don’t do reviews but this was worth it because it’s been a month and she still is happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dubin

customer_reviews.title: K&H Pet Products Lectro-Soft Outdoor Heated Bed is wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: K&H Pet Products Lectro-Soft Outdoor Heated Bed is awesome! I have 4 rescue puppies we've raised from 8 -15 weeks, they love it and have not chewed through the cord like the RIOGOO Pet Heating Pad. This pad is very easy to clean, only thing was the cover was not secure and so falls of easily but honestly this pad is so soft they just lay directly on it and sleep like babies! The temperature is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: cooknwoman

customer_reviews.title: Nice warming bed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this warming bed for our cat to help recuperate from surgery and so far she seems to avoid it. I'm sure in no time she'll use it. Comes nicely packaged and the plug is nicely wrapped to keep the curious one from gnawing at it. Bed didn't seem too warm but that's just my personal opinion.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to dog house on porch.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog comes in at night, but during the day we needed her to have some warmth (we work and she gets to roam our acreage instead of being locked inside all day). I find her in the doghouse on the pad frequently taking a nap. We keep it on and plug in and she loves it. Doesn’t get so hot it would melt anything, but give a nice warmth when laying on it.
customer_reviews.author: SR1988

customer_reviews.title: They hate to be indoors
customer_reviews.text: I have it placed in a small dog house, for my two dogs. They hate to be indoors, and with a heated dog house they can enjoy the outdoors even in the wintertime. It worked flawlessly all winter long, and I think it deserves 5 stars. Tip: buy an inexpensive thermocube plug-in. Plug the pad into the thermocube. It won't be turning on unless the thermocube senses 36 degrees or so. Still providing warm shelter with energy savings.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my feral cat house.
customer_reviews.text: I had a large 4 cat feral cat house with a 36" x 36" plastic heater for around 10 years. All the feral's are gone now but one, and I built her a much smaller house, but the heater was too big for it. I bought this one because it was small. Wow, is it nice. My old heater was hard plastic, this one is soft. The cat absolutely loves the thing. It uses very little electricity but heats up nicely. Highly recommend this heater for a one cat house.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, durable pad
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, durable pad, the cover was a little thinner than I anticipated, but doesn't really matter, I got a spare for when I hand- wash the other one. Took me a bit to figure out how to inflate it, but got it done and it was actually easy, I just didn't know how to do it. I think she will be so happy this winter in her snug little house with this nice heated pad! Thanks for making my outdoor cat more comfortable, as she has a screaming fit if she's brought indoors for ANY reason.
customer_reviews.author: Phae

customer_reviews.title: Long term review
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these pads in 2014. The first two years, we only used them during the cold months outside on a covered deck and the cats loved them. Then we left them plugged in indoors, all day every day for the next 3+ years and they are still working and my cats sleep on them every day. We recently purchased replacement covers because the cat hair was woven into the cover and could not be washed out. We have two 14+ yr old cats who will not sleep anywhere else. I would highly recommend this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Yuk

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small/Medium pet boxes in the winter time!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I bought several for the stray cats to get warm in the winter time. My husband built a few small cat houses/boxes and put them in our back yard. It keeps the enclosure a lot more warmer than the weather outside. I love that the the fleece cover comes off easily for laundering and it has steel coils around the electric cord, so the animals can't bite through it and electrocute themselves. Very good thought-out design. And the strays in my neighborhood are very thankful!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Mccall

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I'd prefer having this heating pad for a while longer before rating it, but so far it's exactly as advertised. It's been placed inside a BINGPET Cat Dog Arch House Pet Bed Crate Igloo for Small Animal with Kennel Pad, Brown, all inside the garage, and when it's even slightly chilly, the cat doesn't leave it. I added a low-wattage lamp for additional heat. It's the best she's had it during the winter. I recommend this product. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: works good- overall
customer_reviews.text: works great for our outdoor cat house. it only works when she sits on it & it never gets HOT, just warm enough to keep her comfortable... like 55-65 inside the house... so when it's 25 outside, she is still comfy but won't get sick from the extremes it's stiff when cold, so can be hard to maneuver unless warm another cat marked with urine and i can't get the smell out of the plastic covering
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L H MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Gently warming.
customer_reviews.text: I like the removable washable cover, the coil covered cord and that it doesn't get too hot. We used it for our elderly cat indoors for many months. For some reason the dogs don't like, even outside. But it was perfect for the cat. We even used it in the rat cage for a while. You never have to worry about it overheating the animal.
customer_reviews.author: chickenchick

customer_reviews.title: Great For Outdoor pets
customer_reviews.text: We have an out door cat. We fixed her a place to go in the winter on the patio and had this in the bottom. Wasn't sure if she would use it or not as she is a barn cat and does not like being in a closed space. After she tried it once. She spent the whole winter last year in the "car house". When spring came my husband stored the heatpad. He just got it out again getting ready for this year. Our cat loves it. Wish we had gotten this several years back.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of perfect, endless operation makes these a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one medium and one large version of this in October 2014 and they've both been plugged in constantly since then (it's now December 2016) without any problems. My cats are all old (15/16/16) and these heating pads provide them with a huge amount of comfort. The heat these pads provide is a nice low warming which your pets can sleep on without the chance of overheating. With the included fleece covering it doesn't feel warm to the touch until you press down on it. It's the right amount of heat for long duration sleeping. If something were to happen to either unit I'd immediately replace it with another of the same.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Heating Option...
customer_reviews.text: We are really pleased with this product...we used it in a small dog house for a stray somewhat feral cat for a few years and have 2 for our indoor cats as we don't heat the house much during the work week or overnight and the cats do enjoy them...the instruction States no cover but we place a very thin old tshirt on top and that has not been an issue..really does work on cats weight turning ot on...great sturdy product...highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Hail to the Chief !

customer_reviews.title: DIED AFTER 9 MONTHS (3 1/2 MONTHS OF USE)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item last winter because my poor cat was freezing. It worked great last winter. A month ago I pulled it out again. It worked for like 2 weeks and then died. This item is actually very very expensive if you need to buy it again every 9 months. I am giving them one more chance. If the next one dies I am demanding a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Good for chilly pets!
customer_reviews.text: My small dog (17 lbs) shivers in the cold and hates to wear sweaters. When she’s cold, she knows right where to sit to warm up, we bought the small heated mat only a few days ago! She learned fast that the heated mat was a good place to lay, and now we can’t get her off it. I’m happy knowing she’s more comfy in the cold!
customer_reviews.author: Makennamm

customer_reviews.title: Soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: The cats love it. It puffs up nicely - follow the instructions to get maximum softness. It really is soft to the touch. My cats have a 6' by 6' room of their own, added in our garage, with an outdoor shelter, and an oil radiator style heater inside. The small cat door is open all year (after they broke the hinged door off twice running through it) so it can get chilly in there. In cold weather I know they are comfy on their heated pet beds. The woolly fabric cover can be purchased separately and replaced when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi W.

customer_reviews.title: great product works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an outside cat that I started feeding.The kitty is very timid but I have been feeding him for the past 6 months. It's been cold and raining and I worried about him. I saw this outdoor warmer and placed it on the porch. Now when I open the door he is curled up in his bed waiting for food. I purchased this several months ago and it is still working perfectly. I feel the bed after he has left it and it is warm and toasty. Great product. It comes with a washable sheepskin like cover that is machine washable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Measurements not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I love this item, but the only reason I am giving it 3 stars is because the measurements are not entirely accurate. The package states 14" x 18", but the only measurement somewhat accurate is the width at 17.5" (measurements are rounded to 18"). The depth at 14" is not accurate as only part of the pad measures at 13.5", the ends measure at almost 13". So, if you have a large cat, s/he may not fit on the pad. Otherwise, the product is great and heats up.
customer_reviews.author: GotMoxie

customer_reviews.title: Happy, warm kitties
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I ordered this last week! We had a cold snap with wind chills into the teens. We put this in the feral cat house we have on the porch, and the kittens have hardly came out of the box since discovering how warm it is. Husband was very pleased with how sturdy the pad is and the substantial cord. Very pleased with our order!
customer_reviews.author: MonnaMia

customer_reviews.title: Out cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We put the pad inside of our cats soft-sided crate/house and absolutely loves it! (This is being used indoors.) We put a soft towel over the pad cover and have it plugged into a surge suppressor - it's on 24/7. It never gets or feels 'hot' , just snuggily warm. She much happier with a warm comfy bed. Would highly recommend this to anyone whose pet gets chilled/chilly or just plain loves to be warm!
customer_reviews.author: Maki A Green

customer_reviews.title: heating pad kept two feral cats comfortable all winter 2020
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog house in my back yard and two feral cats stayed there this winter using this heating pad to keep them warm. It really works 24/7 which was great . You don't have to adjust it. I was not sure that it was working well or not but the cats knew and relied on it. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Lindamarie

customer_reviews.title: really works!!
customer_reviews.text: had i known these things could have existed when i was a child i would have been so relieved when thinking of all the 'little ones' out there. this product was too good to be true by description, so in this world i was wondering.. well, we are on the otherside of the winter now and our little 'cat who adopted us' has had a wonderful winter in his new house with this mattress. today, february, i checked it after he got up...and it still works just as described. i would buy this mattress again and i want everyone to know this product is this good. a true lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized for our warmth-seeking Boston Terrier
customer_reviews.text: It took all of two minutes for our little Boston Terrier who is always cold and wanting to snuggle under blankets or lie in the sunshine to discover this and claim it as her new favorite spot. She's 26 pounds, and it barely fits her, so I certainly wouldn't suggest it for a larger breed. I am surprised at the reviews that say they can't tell if it's getting warm, because it definitely feels gently warm (not hot) to the touch when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: S Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly durable heating pad!
customer_reviews.text: I built house for my outside cats and bought this heating pad for the house. The house I built had a big leak in it from the wood getting moisture, freezing and cracking. This pad continued to heat and was actually evaporating the water out of the cat house! It never get hit but is always warm. I will definitely buy again if I need one!
customer_reviews.author: Hollis Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We recently got an outdoor cat (just showed up one day and never left) and I couldn't imagine him being outside on the really cold nights. This was the perfect solution! We put this in his little house on our covered porch and he sleeps in there every night now. It makes me feel so much better to know he has a warm place to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brittony

customer_reviews.title: Feral cats appreciate the warmth
customer_reviews.text: We have a small feral cat colony (catch, neuter and release) that have stayed with us for several years. They really appreciate the warmth these heaters provide in the western New York state winters. We have several of them setup in "cat boxes" that are sheltered from the environment and the ferals use them often.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Zapetis

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Purchase and Ohio Approved
customer_reviews.text: We used this in conjunction with a house we purchased online and kept in aganist our house under a cover porch, plugged directly into the outdoor ourlet on the house. I tried to tell my husband not to add anything extra as the directions stated but we still added a small blantket around the house to make small nest. Ohio gets cold and snows a lot. My cat loved this pad so much! We purchased in the fall and now going into the spring have no complaints. The cord is reinforced and the pad is extra thick. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gesika

customer_reviews.title: ... this heating pad for our outdoor feral who didn't enjoy being inside too often for the winter months here ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heating pad for our outdoor feral who didn't enjoy being inside too often for the winter months here in California. This was setup inside an outdoor cat house (from Petlife) on a timer under our outdoor cabana and would go on during the night hours up until the early mornings, just until the sun would rise. In addition to cardboard and blankets, this pad really provided a good amount of warmth to keep him nice and warm. I'm very happy with this product a lot. And the barrier surrounding the power cord was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: XYZ

customer_reviews.title: Cat is dumb, but this works great
customer_reviews.text: It took my indoor-only cat about 4 months to figure this out. I thought she'd take to it immediately because she loves laying on rectangular things. Boxes, paper, a tape-rectangle on the floor. Not this time. She initially avoided this, I suspect because it's air-filled. I got it for her because she likes to sit by the window for hours but it gets chilly there. She eventually figured it out and now she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves to be on this. I use it in the cooler months of the year. I put it away for summer. Have been using these pads for some years now. Highly recommend! My kitty is strictly an inside kitty. Cannot say what these are like outside. Would think they would be wonderful. They would not be appropriate for any damp area, as they plug into electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good choice!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Perfect size. This is the large one, bought it for my three little monsters, together they probably weigh close to 50 pounds. It heats well, love that is doesn’t get too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Torres

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dog warm at night
customer_reviews.text: My dog is now 13 and an outdoor dog. Some nights she needs a little help. I tried a heating pad in her bed, but it was too hot. It took a couple of days for her to fully accept the bed, but now she really seems to like it. It is not so warm that she does not like it, but keeps her from getting cold.
customer_reviews.author: Dually 7.3

product_meta.title: K&H Pet Products
product_meta.description: Size:Small 14 X 18 Inches| Style:Retail BoxThe K&H Pet Products Lectro-Soft Outdoor Heated Pet Bed is the soft orthopedic design of the Original Lectro-Kennel that you have heard about. And just like the Original K&H Lectro-Kennel...it comes with a free fleece cover!!! The K&H Lectro-Soft has all of the great features of the K&H Original Lectro-Kennel, but it is made of softer material giving owners much more flexibility in placement and transportation, and giving your pets extra comfort. Lectro-Kennel has been warming pets for over 50 years, and the K&H Lectro-Soft has quickly become a heated pet bed favorite. Designed for doghouses, basements, garages, barns, sheds, porches or any other outdoor shelter, the K&H Pet Products Lectro-Soft Outdoor Heated Pet Bed with free cover is the perfect outdoor heated bed to keep your pets warm on a chilly day. It uses an internal thermostat to keep the temperature at a desirable 102 when the pet lies upon the pad, and will remain 10-15 degrees above ambient air temperature when your pet is not on the bed. The unit is constructed of a soft but durable material and has a steel wrapped cord to ensure your pet's safety. The Lectro-Soft comes in multiple sizes and shapes and is extremely low wattage. This heated dog mat has been tested & certified by MET Labs to exceed USA/CA electrical safety standards. One year manufacturer's warranty. Note: This is a soft bed that is NOT recommended for destructive dogs. If you have a pet that chews or is destructive in any way we suggest the Original K&H Lectro-Kennel Outdoor Heated Pad.
feature_bullets: Lectro Soft Heated Pet Bed is extremely low wattage.
Perfect for doghouses, basements, garages, barns, sheds, porches or any other outdoor shelter.
This soft, orthopedic bed is unique in that it will still provide soft, comfortable warmth even in sub-zero weather!
Super soft PVC is used on the exterior to ensure the bed doesn't absorb water and stay wet like a fabric bed would. Indoor or outdoor use. One year limited warranty.
20 Watts. Small 14" x 18". Weatherproof for indoor or outdoor use. 5 1/2" steel-wrapped, chew-resistant cord. Great for dog house, porches, garages, barns, or in the home.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
